{"step_by_step_thinking": "Alpha-thalassemia trait is a form of thalassemia which affects the alpha globin gene. This condition is characterized by a decrease in the production of alpha globin chains. Hemoglobin electrophoresis is a test that separates the different types of hemoglobin based on their electrical charge. In alpha-thalassemia trait, the production of HbF (fetal hemoglobin) and HbA2 (a minor component of adult hemoglobin) is not affected, so their levels should be normal.", "answer_choice": "B. Normal HbF and normal HbA2"}
